column5: CHICAGO Monsanto Co   having ditched an audacious $46 billion offer for Syngenta AG   may downshift to a humbler strategy of beefing up its crop protection portfolio through other acquisitions  partnerships and licensing agreements.

column4: Monsanto  rivals eye next step after Syngenta deal collapse
column5: CHICAGO  Aug 26 Monsanto Co  having ditched an audacious $46 billion offer for Syngenta AG   may downshift to a humbler strategy of beefing up its crop protection portfolio through other acquisitions  partnerships and licensing agreements.

column4: Novo Nordisk to buy two private pharma research firms
column5: COPENHAGEN Novo Nordisk  said on Thursday it has agreed to buy  two private biopharmaceutical research companies specializing in diabetes Calibrium LLC and MB2 LLC.

column4: TRLPC: Peabody's secondary loan pricing steady despite restructuring reports
column5: NEW YORK  August 27 US coal producer Peabody Energy's US$1.2bn term loan traded unchanged at around 73-74 percent of face value in the US secondary loan market  loan traders said on Thursday  following press reports that the struggling company has hired Lazard Ltd to help to restructure its debt amid plunging commodity prices.

column4: UPDATE 1-PetroChina profit dives 63 percent in first half
column5: BEIJING  Aug 27 PetroChina     China's biggest oil and gas producer  reported a 63 percent drop in first-half profits  with earnings upstream and in the marketing segment hit by lower prices  while earnings from natural gas jumped.

column4: PetroChina profit dives 63 pct in first half
column5: BEIJING  Aug 27 PetroChina     China's biggest oil and gas producer  reported a 63 percent drop in its first-half profit  with earnings upstream and in the marketing segment both taking a hit from lower prices.

column4: MIDEAST STOCKS - Factors to watch - Aug 27
column5: DUBAI  Aug 27 Here are some factors that may affect Middle East stock markets on Thursday. Reuters has not verified the press reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column4: UPDATE 1-Petrobras management urges board to delay unit IPO  source says
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Aug 27 Management at state-controlled Petróleo Brasileiro SA has urged the company's board to delay a planned initial public offering of its fuel distribution unit as market conditions soured  a person with direct knowledge of the situation said on Thursday.

column4: Petrobras needs $4.3 bln to finish 1st unit at Comperj refinery
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Aug 27 Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA needs $4.3 billion to complete the first 165 000 barrel-a-day operating unit at its stalled Comperj refinery outside Rio de Janeiro  the company's refining chief said on Thursday.

column4: Petrobras management asked board to delay unit IPO  source says
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Aug 27 Management at state-controlled Petróleo Brasileiro SA recommended the company's board in a recent meeting to delay a planned initial public offering plan of its fuel distribution unit due to souring market conditions  a source with direct knowledge of the situation said on Thursday.

column4: U.S. leaning against regulatory relief for 3 banks in Libor scandal
column5: WASHINGTON  Aug 27 The U.S. Labor Department is leaning toward denying requests for regulatory relief by three big foreign banks that pleaded guilty to manipulating Libor interest rates but want to keep managing  retirement accounts for clients.

column4: Taiwan stocks jump on Wall St; TSMC  Ilitek rally
column5: TAIPEI  Aug 27 Taiwan stocks rose along with other Asian bourses on Thursday as a rally on Wall Street calmed jittery investors  with technology exporters such as TSMC  leading the way.

column4: Tiffany earnings fall as high costs  strong dollar bite
column5: Tiffany & Co  posted a 15 percent drop in quarterly earnings due to a strong dollar and the cost of developing and bringing out new products  sending shares of the luxury jeweler to an 18-month low. | Video

column4: Tiffany & Co posts second straight fall in quarterly sales
column5: Aug 27 Luxury jeweler Tiffany & Co's  sales fell for the second straight quarter  hurt by lower spending by tourist in the United States and a stronger dollar that reduced the value of overseas sales.

column4: Total sells North Sea gas pipelines for $907 mln
column5: PARIS  Aug 27 French oil major Total  has agreed to sell some of its gas pipeline assets in the UK's North Sea to North Sea Midstream Partners  an affiliate of U.S.-based private equity firm ArcLight Capital  for 585 million pounds ($907 million).

column4: White House says Keystone XL pipeline review continues
column5: ABOARD AIR FORCE ONE  Aug 27 The White House said on Thursday that the U.S. State Department continues to review TransCanada Corp's proposed Keystone XL pipeline from Canada's oil sands to Gulf Coast refineries.

column5: RIO DE JANEIRO/SYDNEY Brazilian mining giant Vale has continued its disposal of non-core holdings  agreeing to sell a mothballed coal mine in Australia jointly to Glencore Plc and Bloomfield Group for an undisclosed sum.

column4: Wal-Mart to stop selling AR-15  other semi-automatic rifles
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  the United States' top seller of guns and ammunition  said on Wednesday it would stop selling the AR-15 and other semi-automatic rifles because of sluggish demand and focus instead on "hunting and sportsman firearms."

column4: Wal-Mart boosts holiday layaway  eyeing Star Wars toy launch
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  said it will bring forward its holiday layaway program by two weeks  as the world's largest retailer hopes to get a jump on year-end demand and fuel sales of soon-to-be-launched Star Wars toys.

column4: Wal-Mart boosts holiday layaway  eyeing Star Wars toy launch
column5: Aug 27 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said it will bring forward its holiday layaway program by two weeks  as the world's largest retailer hopes to get a jump on year-end demand and fuel sales of soon-to-be-launched Star Wars toys.

column4: ESPN  CBS Radio to promote podcasts at industry ad event
column5: Aug 27 CBS Radio and Walt Disney's  ESPN are joining a handful of companies that will promote podcasts to advertisers at the Interactive Advertising Bureau's first podcast upfronts next month  executives told Reuters.

column4: 'Star Wars' toys get marathon roll-out in Disney merchandising push
column5: LOS ANGELES "Star Wars" producers on Wednesday announced a marathon  worldwide roll-out of toys next week for its upcoming "The Force Awakens" movie in a promotional push that seeks to capture the  excitement that once greeted new "Harry Potter" book releases. | Video
